dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowy suburbs of Toronto. From a nondescript house we hea

dialogues.speaker: KIM PINE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Scott Pilgrim is dating a high schooler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four twenty-somethings lounge around a small kitchen tabl STEPHEN STILLS, 25, shaggy hair, Canadian Cowboy chic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Is she hot? KIM PINE, 22, cute, bitter, sweatshirt with a zipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you now, Scott? Like twenty-eight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not playing your little games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've been out of high school for like, 13 years and-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm twenty-two. Twenty-two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're dating a high school girl? Not bad, not bad. YOUNG NEIL, 20, simple mind, layered T-shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, did you guys 'do it' yet? SCOTT PILGRIM, 22, fresh faced and charmingly cocky with unruly yet adorable mop of hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have done many things. We ride the bus. We have meaningful conversations about how yearbook club went and about her friends and, um...you know...drama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, have you even kissed her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We almost held hands once, but then she got embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Aren't you pleased as punch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased as punch) Knives Chau. She's Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Chinese... Young Neil pauses his Nintendo DS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wicked! How'd you meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I mentioned the bus? Scott Pilgrim prepares to tell an amazing story:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNIVES CHAU, 17, cute and innocent with clothes to match, sits next to her mother, MOTHER CHAU, 45, demanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are seventeen year old! Time to get interested in boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Knives DROPS her bag, books scattering everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drop book. Knives crouches down to pick up her books, grumbling.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey... Knives looks up to see the cute and gallant SCOTT PILGRIM holding her books. TEXT appears in an on-screen box:

dialogues.speaker: "SCOTT PILGRIM, 22 YEARS OLD, RATING
dialogues.text: Stars appear in Knives's eyes. Scott grins heroically. Sc winks at Knives. Scott winks at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the kitchen, everyone looks at Scott...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that seriously the end of the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It is. Young Neil unpauses his Nintendo DS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when do we get to meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please. Let it be soon. DINGY DONG! The doorbell rings. Scott smiles broadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for me.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. STEPHEN STILLS' HOUSE
dialogues.text: An eager Knives stands outside. Scott opens the door a cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise to be good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'll be good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. Please be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I normally not? Stephen Stills comes to the door and peers through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. Knives, this is Stephen Stills. He's the talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. STILLS shuts the door on a confused Knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she gonna geek out on us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll just sit in the corner, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I want her to geek out on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll geek. She geeks. She has the capacity to geek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen Stills quickly opens the door and waves Knives in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knives enters, looking around the rehearsal pad with awe: Bare bulb, ratty rug, drums, guitar, bass, LAME BRAND amp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knives, that's Kim. Lemme get your coat. Scott throws Knives' coat on the floor. Knives waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, sorry, what was your name?

dialogues.speaker: KIM PINE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play the drums? REVEAL Kim sitting behind the drumset, sticks in her hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is so awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knives, that's Young Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. What do you play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, wow...Zelda...Tetris...that's kind of a big question. Knives stares blankly at Young Neil, who finally gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I'm not in the band. I just live here. Sex Bob-Omb has geared up. Amps hum to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's start with Launchpad McQuack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the actual title of the-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT PILGRIM VS THE WORLD
dialogues.text: TITLES continue over the song as the small rehearsal spac seems to GROW with the music. Stephen Stills barks unintelligable lyrics. Knives watches, jaw ajar. The song ends, feedback lingeri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys...are so...amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott bids adieu to a stunned Knives as she gets on a bus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't even...Sex Bob-Omb. Amazing.

dialogues.text: The band and Young Neil lounge around Stephen Stills' roo

dialogues.text: She seems nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeaaah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeaaah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, if your life had a face I would punch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeaaah...wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, are you really happy or are you really evil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, do I have ulterior motives or something? I'm offended, Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wounded even?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurt, Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, you were saying she seems awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she seems awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeaaaah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott hangs his coat up in a tiny, one room apartment. He turns to WALLACE WELLS, dark hair, arched eyebrow, disloy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you hear some dirty lies from someone else, yes, I'm dating a 17 year old. Wallace looks up from the NOW magazine he's reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha, ha, ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean we have to stop sleeping together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're totally my bitch forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. The whole seventeen year old thing. Don't tell too many people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean. Don't tell my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me. Wallace tosses the NOW magazine aside, starts texting.

dialogues.speaker: STACEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Seventeen years old? Scandal! Intercut with STACEY PILGRIM, cute, peppy barista, gabbin her cellphone in THE SECOND CUP. A sign behind her reads you are using your cellphone, you will not be served'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. Who told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace. Duh.

dialogues.text: That gossipy bitch.

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE, (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace! Wallace clicks off. Scott sinks into an armchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this mysterious child you date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name is Knives. Knives Chau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seventeen year old Chinese schoolgirl? You're ridiculous.

dialogues.text: Yeah, the whole deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, you haven't-

dialogues.text: No no no. We haven't even held hands. I think she hugged me once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Scott. Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...it's just nice, you know? It's just...simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been over a year since you got dumped by she-who-will-not-be-named. Scott glances down at the partially obscured NOW magazine looking into the HOT GIRL'S EYES on the back cover album

dialogues.speaker: STACEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, are you legitimately moving on, or is this just you being insane? Scott looks at a strip of photobooth pictures: he smiles to a hot redhead in happier times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get back to you on that? A SCHOOL BELL clangs loudly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace and Scott stand outside a CATHOLIC HIGH SCHOOL. Uniformed boys and girls pour out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not want to be here. At all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This school has boys too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you. Even I would think twice about dating a seventeen year old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playtime?

dialogues.text: That doesn't sound so good either.

dialogues.speaker: KNIVES CHAU, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Scott! Heyyyy! Knives skips to Scott. Her shy friend TAMARA lingers behi

dialogues.text: Yes. Does he wear glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace, you go now! Begone! Wallace pulls Knives close. Whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too good for him. Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott and Knives play NINJA NINJA REVOLUTION (think a mar arts version of DANCE DANCE REVOLUTION). They punch and kick in unison, side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know the original name of Pac- man was Puck-man? You would think it's because Pac-Man looks like a yellow hockey puck, but actually it comes from the Japanese phrase paku-paku which means to flap ones mouth open and closed. They changed it over here because Puck-Man is too easy to vandalize. You know, scratch out the P and turn it into an F or whatever? Knives flips over Scott's back in a COMBO move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmigod, like...wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Wow. The game ends. CONTINUE appears, counting down: 10...9... Scott looks at Knives. She digs for quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott and Knives leave a pizza joint, slices in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is into this Korean guy, Bobby, but everyone thinks Bobby has a crush on Mina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Derek and Tamara had a mutual like-each-other thing going, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't listen to much music. I know a lot of kids who play piano or whatever, but you guys ROCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I personally rocked, but I never suspected that we rocked as a unit. Thank you, Knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you guys are gonna be HUGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're already pretty big. But it might be cool if cool people wore our T-shirt. Knives speaks to a female clerk, surly with tats and spec

dialogues.text: Thank you, Julie.

dialogues.text: Thank you, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I heart them so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hearted them too until they signed to a major label and the singer turned into a total bitch and ruined my life. But that's just me.

dialogues.text: Envy Adams is sooo cool. Do you read her blog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, you were saying about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I've...I've never gone out with someone so talented.

dialogues.text: You go out with a lot of guys?

dialogues.text: Yeah, so whatever, man!

dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.text: Scott and Knives walk up to the front of Wallace's apartm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Wow. Wind blows. The light snowfall turns into sand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Scott wanders alone through a barren land. He falls to knees next to a lonely cactus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...so...so alone. A MYSTERIOUS GIRL rollerblades across the shifting sands. wears fishnets, an army jacket, skirt and goggles. Her pi hair is funky but cool. She is hotter than the desert sun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not alone. You're just having some idiotic dream.

dialogues.text: Does that mean we can make out? But she's gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Oh God... Wallace wakes up to the left of Scott, rubbing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had this totally weird dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.text: Scott is noticeably taller than all the teens in the libr He carries a stack of books for Knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know that girl? The Rollerblading Girl delivers a package from AMAZON.CA the librarian. Scott's gaze follows the GIRL as she blade out of the library. Pensive guitar underscores his though

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott? Scott continues to stare at the girl. Time slows to a cra

dialogues.text: Scott stands in the rehearsal room, head still in the clo

dialogues.text: I'll... I'll be quieter.

dialogues.text: Let's do that one again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to this party, retard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Julie's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww maaan...

dialogues.text: A bored Scott stands next to Young Neil in a very crowded house party. Both have red plastic cups in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...this sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go pee due to boredom. Scott exits frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil sips his drink. Scott passes by COMEAU, a bespectacled hipster geek:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Comeau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Scott. Some party huh? You gettin' your drink on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Coke Zero. I don't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't drink? I remember you getting ridiculously drunk off two G&T's one time and-

dialogues.text: Comeau, you know everyone, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know this one girl with hair like this? Scott sketches an incomprehensible drawing of Ramona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah man. Ramona Flowers. Someone said she was coming tonight actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the hots for her? I hear she's hardcore... Scott has already left a Scott-shaped dust cloud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott scans the party. His eyes go WIDE. He CRUSHES his plastic cup. There she is...playing the wall...RAMONA! Al Enigmatic. Hot. Scott sidles up and stands next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you know Pacman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know of him. Scott begins to babble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you know Pac-Man was originally Puckman but not because Pac-Man looks like a hockey puck and paku-paku-paku means flapping your mouth and they changed it because if you scratch out the "P" and turn it into an "F'? You know? Like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah that's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...am I dreaming? Ramona looks at Scott blankly. He slowly skulks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave you alone forever now.

dialogues.speaker: "THEN HE STALKED HER FOR THE REST OF THE PARTY..."

dialogues.speaker: WHUH

dialogues.text: But you should talk to Sandra and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's so 'Ramona Quimby, Aged 8' and yet...Flowers. The girls laugh. Scott does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What else? JUMP CUT through a FLURRY OF FACES as Scott asks everyone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard she kicks all kind of ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on another level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got men dying at her feet.

dialogues.text: She's got some battle scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to be entered into lightly We end on the surly JULIE (the rude clerk) who steps in f of Scott, arms crossed. Stephen Stills is with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Ramona Flowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know her? Tell me. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just moved here. Got a job with Amazon. Comes into my work.

dialogues.text: That they had a huge fight or whatever?

dialogues.text: Did they reeeally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't know what it is about that girl, she just-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you guys broke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you scaring off the coolest girl at my party Scott. We all know you're a total lady killer wannabe jerky jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: That time with Lisa-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That time with Hollie-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That time you dumped Kim for-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, me and Kim are all good now. SCOTT looks to KIM. We hear the sound of arctic winds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, Ramona is out of your league, let's leave it at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And anyway, I'm not even sure she really did have a big breakup. She keeps mentioning some guy named Gideon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't know what it is about that girl, she just-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Scott lies on the futon, WIDE awake. Wallace storms in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who's druuunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guess right. Wallace flops onto the futon, landing next to Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, that girl. From my dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl. Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her at the library...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Library...can I pretend we're talking about a guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then I'm at this party, and hey! There she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's the girl of my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Then you should break up with your fake high school girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been so sure about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you should break up with your fake high school girlfriend.

dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not getting it, friend. Wallace drifts off. RINGY RING! Scott answers. INTERCUT w STACEY sitting on a bus on her cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking of juggling two chicks!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you should break up with your fake high school girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh. Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not even conscious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. You of all people should know how sucky it is to get cheated on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have a job to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I should send out a mass text about this. Bye. Scott looks to Wallace, who is out cold, cellphone in han

dialogues.text: Wallace, how do you do that? HARD CUT to MORNING LIGHT filling the room!

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: Wallace sits bolt upright. Scott sits at Wallace's comput

dialogues.text: Amazon.ca. What's the website for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Amazon.ca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome! I have to order something reeeally cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You've got mail!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! This thing claims I have mail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing what they can do with computers these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! Now I'm reading it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear Mr. Pilgrim, It has come to my attention that we will be fighting soon. My name is Matthew Patel, and I'm" blah blah 'fair warning' blah blah...hmm. This is...this is...THIS IS...!!!

dialogues.text: This is boring. Delete! 'CLICK.' Scott walks to the front door. Moments pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott. Are you waiting for the package you just ordered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the weekend. It won't ship until Monday at the earliest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying? Scott opens the door. It's KNIVES CHAU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heyyy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack hug! Knives smothers Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack hug. That's cute. He plasters on his best fake smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember you were supposed to meet me at the bus stop a half-hour ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I possibly forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott and Knives flip through the record bins, out of syn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yearbook club is getting SO boring. I cannot believe the music they put on while we work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knives buys a hip and trendy jacket. Scott sits on a couc next to the DO NOT SIT sign, still distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah broke up with Alan and now she's all into Derek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott and Knives walk out of a pizza joint. Knives chows on a slice. Scott doesn't eat, his thoughts elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but Tamara claims she has dibs on Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell ya'.

dialogues.text: Scott and Knives play NINJA NINJA REVOLUTION, side by sid Scott plays halfheartedly, his timing off.

dialogues.text: Combo! Knives goes to flip over Scott, but he messes up. THE MIR IMAGE of Scott's videogame avatar appears on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh, NegaNinja. NEGANINJA - squares up against Scott's avatar.

dialogues.text: I can never get past that guy. Scott has his little videogame head cut off. The 'CONTIN countdown comes up...10...9...8...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to keep going? Scott takes a long look at Knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I think...I think... Scott takes a deep breath. This is never easy. 3...2...1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game on, everybody. Game. On. An excited Stills addresses Sex Bob-Omb. Scott tunes his bass, alone by the window, staring out.

dialogues.text: I got us a show.

dialogues.speaker: OH MY GOSH WHEN
dialogues.text: Knives BURSTS into frame. Scott winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wednesday, The Rockit. And even better? It's the T.I.B.B.

dialogues.text: The Toronto International Battle of The Bands?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'right. This guy at work was like "Steve, do you know anyone in a band?" and I was like 'I'm in a band' and he was like 'You're in a band?' and I was like 'Yeah I'm totally in a band'-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great story, man.

dialogues.text: Is there a prize or something?!

dialogues.text: You don't know?

dialogues.text: Indie Producer of the millennium?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Stills gestures to Knives' home-made Sex Bob-Omb T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we win...it won't just be Knives wearing a Sex Bob-Omb shirt. It'll be the cool kids too. Knives can barely contain herself. She grabs Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will do everything I can to get out of study group and come.

dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, who are you battling?

dialogues.text: Yeah that's the one.

dialogues.text: I hate them!

dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, I hate them too!

dialogues.text: Yeah, they suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott pees in a state of dreamy reverie. The PEE BAR abov his head slowly reduces. He stares at himself in the mirr Scott exits the bathroom, entering...

RAMONA FLOWERS bursts through the door, skating past Scot and down the hall, PACKAGE from AMAZON clutched in her ha Scott runs after her, around a corner, down a row of LOCK leading to...the outside of WALLACE'S APARTMENT???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott LEAPS out of the futon and RUNS towards the front d THROWING IT OPEN and startling Ramona Flowers just as she presses the doorbell. DINGY DONG...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, um, I was thinking about asking you out, but then I realized how stupid that would be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go out sometime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, no, that's okay. You just have to sign for this alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just woke up, and you were in my dream. I dreamt you were delivering me this package. Is that weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not weird at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's just like, you've got this really convenient subspace highway running through your head that I like to use. It's like three miles in fifteen seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. I forgot you guys don't have that in Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember me do you? I met you at the party the other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you the Pac-Man guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not even. That was some total ass. I was the other guy. You're Ramona Flowers right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're like American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, am I coming off as rude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. Noooooo... Scott stands in awe of Ramona. She gives him a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know...you need to sign for this. Whatever this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's something really cool. You'd be impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still have to sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I sign for it, you'll leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's how it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay well, can we just maybe just hang out sometime? Get to know each other? You're the new kid on the block, right? I've lived here forever. I mean...there are reasons for you to hang out with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are like...my dream girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to find a new route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either that or you need to start hanging out with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to hang out with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...you know...if that's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I say yes, will you sign for your damn package? Scott finally signs on the dotted line. And throws the package straight in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. So, yeah. Eight o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott finds Ramona waiting at the top of some stairs in t park. The Toronto skyline gleams in the night behind them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you just standing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I'm totally waiting on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I just assumed you were too cool to be on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. You assumed wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want to do? We could get a slice at Pizza Pizza or flip through some records at Sonic Boom. Oh, or there's this awesome game called Ninja Ninja Revolution at-

dialogues.text: I'm not into simulated violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cool with whatever you want to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good. Scott and Ramona trudge through the snow in the empty par

dialogues.text: This is good. So how'd you end up in Toronto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just needed to escape I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got this job here. And Gideon had always said Toronto was one of the great cities so...

dialogues.text: Is Gideon...is he your boyfriend?

dialogues.text: He's...a friend.

dialogues.text: Was he your boyfriend?

dialogues.text: So what about you? What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm between jobs.

dialogues.text: Between what and what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My last job is a long story filled with sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know plenty of those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you left New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much. It was time to head somewhere a little more chilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's certainly chilled here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Uh. Chilled as in cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm totally obsessed with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to get you obsessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just haven't been obsessed with a girl for a long time. It's weird.

dialogues.text: That's probably because you sleep with a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was guessing from your apartment, but you totally do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... we're just poor! We can't afford two beds! We're not gay! Actually... no... Wallace is pretty gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, relax. I believe you. You're too desperate to be gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel so stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... mostly stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're definitely stupid if you want to go out with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, yeah. The snowfall gets heavier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. Isn't it like April?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I can barely see you. This whole thing is an unmitigated disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think 'act of God' is a pretty decent excuse for a lousy date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is a 'date', eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say 'date'? Slip of the tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tongue... The snow gets heavier still. Ramona walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, night's not over yet. I think there's a thingy up here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thingy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door? I... I... I can't see you. I'm blind. Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door with a STAR on it appears out of the whiteness. Ra opens the door. Scott and Ramona fall into blackness...

dialogues.text: Did you make some of those up?

dialogues.text: I think I'll have sleepytime.

dialogues.text: That sounds good to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get you a blanket.

dialogues.text: That would actually be awesome. Ramona exits. After a moment alone, Scott ventures upstai He wanders towards a half open door. Pushing it open, he finds Ramona in her bedroom in her bra and skirt.

dialogues.text: AAAH! Sorry, I'm just...cold!

dialogues.text: Here, does this help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh...kay. They look into each others eyes...camera circles Scott an Ramona as they begin an awesome make out session. Scott imagines himself soundtracking the kiss with a slinky bas Ramona breaks off, smiling. Scott is in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you..were you just going to bring the blanket from your bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe...maybe we should both get under it...since we're so cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...what about our tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can...not have tea. The slinky bassline continues as Ramona takes her skirt o revealing black panties to complement black bra. Scott ta his shirt off. They tumble onto the bed and make out. The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh...kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like I'm gonna send you home in a snowstorm or anything. You can sleep in my bed. And I reserve the right to change my mind about the sex later. Ramona curls up next to Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is cool, just this. It's been like a really long time, and this is...I think I needed this. Whatever this is. So, thanks.

dialogues.text: You're welcome. They exchange a smile. Then without warning we jump cut t

Another arrow point out that-
Ramona steps out of the bathroom in a towel. Scott relaxe

dialogues.text: Hey, can this not be a one night stand? For one thing, I didn't even get any...that was a joke.

dialogues.text: It's just nerves! Pre-show jitters. People love us. Right? Scott sounds less than convincing. He looks up at Ramona Knives sitting with Wallace, Jimmy and Stacey in the BALC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crash and The Boys tune up. A drunk Wallace turns to Jimm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy. Do they rock or suck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They...haven't started playing yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a test, Jimmy. You passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. I am Crash, and these are the Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. TRASHA, 8 year old girl drummer, gives Wallace the finger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex Bob-omb peer at the band from offstage. Kim glowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a girl drummer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is called "I am so sad. I am so very very sad." And it goes a little something like this. Crash and the Boys play a whole song in .04 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Wallace yells from the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This song is for the guy who keeps yelling from the balcony, and it's called "We Hate You, Please Die."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet! I love this one!

dialogues.speaker: B41 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Crash continues his rampage of musical hate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys are good. Are these guys good? Kim Pine scowls harder than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys are good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is called "Last Song Kills Audience". It'll be our last song tonight and your last song EVER... Sound explodes from the stage. The audience are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stills paces backstage as the others watch the band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we supposed to follow this? We're not going to win, we're not gonna sign with G-Man and we'll never play opening night at the Chaos Theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Crash And The Boys climax, Stacey turns to Ramona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how do you know Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's...um. He's a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard for me to keep track sometimes. He has so many friends. Ramona arches an eyebrow. Stacey turns to Knives and Tama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Knives, how did you meet Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott looks up into the balcony, sees Stacey talking to Knives. He turns around and slaps Stephen Stills in the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta play now and loud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stacey and Ramona listen intently to Knives' story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was on the bus with my Mom- Knives freezes, staring at the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that seriously the end of the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OH MY GOSH, they're on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONSTAGE: A DISHEVELED PROMOTER walks to the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This next band is from Toronto and...yeah. So give it up for Sex...Bob-Omb? SEX BOB-OMB walk on. Wallace and Knives give the only che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott...you ready? Scott nods vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim...you rea-

dialogues.speaker: WE ARE SEX BOB-OMB. ONE, TWO...
dialogues.text: ANGLE on Knives. She faints in the excitement.

dialogues.speaker: THREE, FOUR
dialogues.text: Sex Bob-omb rock out, barely into the first verse when a chunk of ceiling CRASHES down and a SPINDLY INDIAN HIPSTE KID DIVES HEAD FIRST through the hole, finger pointed at Scott as he sails towards the stage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW PATEL lands onstage and glares at Scott through a lopsided fringe. He wears an evil grin and a jacket that borders on flamboyant. He drags on a cigarette (blacked o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Pilgrim. It is I, Matthew Patel. Consider our fight...begun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do? Matthew Patel leaps in the air and sails toward Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do?!

dialogues.speaker: FIGHT
dialogues.text: Scott throws his bass to Young Neil and BLOCKS Patel with left arm, then PUNCHES him across the floor with his righ Patel LANDS like a cat, FLIPS his fringe and GLARES at Sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out! It's that one guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Wallace! Patel RUNS at Scott. Scott SPIN KICKS Patel in the chin a sends him flying into the air. They land in THE PIT, knoc hipsters down and squaring off in the resulting circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quite the opponent, Pilgrim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you anyway? The LIGHTING GUY spotlights the fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Matthew Patel and I'm Ramona's first evil ex-boyfriend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona's first evil ex-boyfriend! All eyes WHIP up to Ramona...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone need another drink? Patel attacks Scott with spin kicks. Scott blocks. Patel punches. Scott blocks, then holds his hand up for a time-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fighting because of Ramona?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you get my e-mail explaining the situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I skimmed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will pay for your insolence! Patel attacks, landing kicks and punches. Scott evades an counter-attacks. Patel evades, then lands more punches. S jump-spins away from danger. They pause, breathing heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up with his outfit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Is he a pirate? Scott looks at Patel's outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a pirate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pirates are in this year! Patel attacks again. They exchange furious blows, until P puts Scott in a choke hold. Scott looks up to Ramona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really went out with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, in the seventh grade. The Lighting Guy SWINGS the spotlight to Ramona in the balcony. We see a sketchy childlike ANIMATED FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was football season and for some reason, all the little jocks wanted me. Matthew was the only non-white, non-jock boy in school, probably in the entire state, so we joined forces and took 'em all out. We were one hell of a team. Nothing could beat Matthew's mystical powers. Nothing but pre-teen capriciousness. We only kissed once. After a week and a half, I told him to hit the showers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spotlight swings back onto Scott and Patel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, wait...mystical powers? Patel levitates into the air and points at Ramona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll pay for this, Flowers! Patel SNAPS his fingers and launches into a BOLLYWOOD SON

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you want to fight me, you're not the brightest. You won't know what's hit you in the slightest. Patel levitates into the air. Four hot girls in skirts wi fangs and bat-wings appear in the air around him.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Me and my fireballs and my Demon Hipster Chicks, I'm talking the talk because I know I'm slick. Patel and the Demon Hipster Chicks shoot FIREBALLS at Sco He flips back onto the stage, narrowly dodging the attack

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fireball Girls! Take this sucker down. The Demon Hipster Chicks unleash more fireballs. Scott dodges. The house drum kit is trashed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let us show him what we're all about. Scott hits the ground, dodging a third wave of fireballs. They explode Crash and the Boys in the wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't even rhyme. Scott rolls across the stage, GRABS one of Kim's CYMBALS throws it Captain America style. It hits Patel square in eyes. POOF, the Demon Hipster Chicks vanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is impossible, how can it be?! Scott leaps into the air. Patel opens his eyes just in ti to see Scott Pilgrim's FIST racing towards his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your eyes. Maybe you'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K.O! Scott punches Patel. He explodes into COINS. They clatter to the stage floor. Scott lands and picks them up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet. Coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona makes her way out fast. Passes Stacey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was great meeting you. Tell your gay friends I said bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gay friends? Stacey turns to see Wallace and Jimmy making out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALLACE?! Not again! Ramona passes Knives, who is being resuscitated by Tamara

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott picks up the coins onstage and counts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw man. $2.40? That's not even enough for the bus home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll lend you the 30 cents. Ramona yanks Scott away. The Promotor ambles back onstage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...so like, Sex Bob-Omb wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knives is now wide awake, clapping wildly from the balcon Her eyes scan the venue for Scott...but he is long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooooooo... A bemused Scott and mortified Ramona sit on the bus home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was all that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I guess... Ramona takes a breath. Looks deep into Scott's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we're going to date, you may have to defeat my seven evil ex's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have seven evil ex-boyfriends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven ex's, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I have to fight-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -defeat your seven evil ex's if we're going to continue to date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what you're saying is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are dating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Do you want to make out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Scott kisses Ramona. The studio audience 'awwww's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bleary Wallace fries bacon. Scott bursts through the fr door, a spring in his step. The studio audience applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, someone got to second base last night. And someone has a second date tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's lucky then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know when I say 'someone', I mean me, right? I got to second base last night...maybe first and a half. Wallace shoots a look at the idiotically upbeat Scott.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, I'm inviting Ramona over for dinner, so you can't be here tonight. I don't want you gaying up the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Scott. But in return I have to issue an ultimatum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of your famous ultimatums?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may live in infamy...You have to break up with Knives. Today. Okay? Scott huffs and helps himself to some of Wallace's bacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...but...it's HARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't do it, I'm going to tell Ramona about Knives. I swear to God, Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you...you're... At this point a sleepy JIMMY wanders out of the bathroom helps himself to coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. Scott points bacon at Wallace accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't make up the gay rulebook. If you have a problem with it, take it up with Liberace's Ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now put the bacon down and go do your dirt while I watch the Lucas Lee marathon on TBS Superstation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Lucas Lee? Wallace points to a hunky actor on the cover of NOW magaz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was this pretty good skater and now he's this pretty good actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's filming a Winifred Hailey movie in Toronto right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make movies in Toronto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I am stalking him later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this Lucas Lee-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas Lee is not important to you right now! Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suck. Surprising no one. Scott grumbles off. Wallace turns the television way up. see Lucas Lee on a payphone in some crummy thriller.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS LEE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Listen close and listen hard, bucko. The next click is me hanging up. The one after that...is me pulling the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shivering and annoyed Scott dials the payphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Knives. Um, do you want to, like, talk or whatever?

dialogues.speaker: KNIVES CHAU, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you wearing a tan jacket? Like a spring jacket? And a hoodie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm... Scott checks what he's wearing. SPOOKY MUSIC underscores.

dialogues.speaker: KNIVES CHAU, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: And a dorky hat?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not dorky! Why are you psychic? A beaming Knives knocks on the payphone glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh...okay. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPOOKY MUSIC continues on in the record store. Scott is on edge as Knives geeks over a standee for THE C AT DEMONHEAD: it features sultry blonde singer ENVY ADAMS posing and the rest of the band shrouded in shadow and mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe they're coming to town. Will you take me to the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, listen- The SPOOKY MUSIC gets louder, pounding inside Scott's hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, I wanted to invite you over for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, Chinese food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. It's not my favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, to meet my parents. It's my birthday dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...I think that's a really bad idea. Like, really, just so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I mean, I'm too old for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not! My Dad is nine years older than my Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...and...are you even allowed to date outside your race or whatever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. I'm in...LOVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knives is so smitten, the word actually appears onscreen. Scott brushes it away. The SPOOKY MUSIC comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, listen...I was thinking we should break up or whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...um...it's not going to work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Scott walks out, leaving Knives in the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott sits on the bus alone, thinking about Knives. CROSSCUT with Knives still in the record store, in shock. ON THE BUS: Scott sighs, thinks of something happier... CROSSCUT with Ramona: rollerblading, her funky pink hair. ON THE BUS: Scott smiles, a little happier.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. STEPHEN STILLS' BASEMENT
dialogues.text: Sex Bob-Omb tune up. Kim spins a drumstick in her fingers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Knives? Not coming tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. No. We broke up. Young Neil PAUSES his DS. Kim and Stills share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OH! Check it out, I learned the bass line from Final Fantasy 2. Scott plays the insanely simple video game tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, you are the salt of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I meant scum of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...you broke up with Knives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but don't worry, maybe you'll meet my new new girlfriend soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newnew. Kim mimes shooting herself. Stills unplugs Scott's amp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! From here on out, no GIRLFRIENDS or GIRLFRIEND talk at practice, whether they're old, new or new-new. We were lucky to survive that last round. This is sudden death now. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! DINGY DONG...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for me. Scott opens the door to see Ramona, now sporting BLUE HAI

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey...you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Like you said. Is it not cool? Scott ushers her in, weirded out by this hair development

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know your hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just dyed it. Are you going to introduce me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, this is Stephen Stills, Young Neil, that's... Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey everyone. Everyone mumbles back. Scott still stares at Ramona's hai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it weird not being pink anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I change my hair every week and a half, dude. Get used to it. (to Sex Bob-Omb) So...uh...how do you guys all know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High school, I guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Neil said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, I actually dated Scott in high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any embarassing stories?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's an idiot. Scott fake laughs. Starts ushering Ramona out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Cool. See you guys tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, what about rehearsal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil knows my parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona lounges, reading a magazine. A tense Scott hurries around the kitchen area, preparing food as Wallace looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you doing okay there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, good. Good. Ramona goes to the bathroom. Scott drops the act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She changed her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? It looks nice blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but she changed it without even making a big deal about it. She's spontaneous. Impulsive. Fickle. Oh my god, what do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you were worried about me gaying up the place. Ramona returns. Wallace pulls on a jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's dinner coming along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, good. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave you lovebirds to it. I'm heading up to Casa Loma to stalk my hetero crush. Scott stops Wallace at the door, with a panicked whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you man the hell up? You could get to 2nd and a half base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you strike out in the next hour, come find me at the Castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'If I strike out'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, 'when'. See you in sixty.

dialogues.speaker: '15 MINUTES LATER'
dialogues.text: Ramona and Scott eat on the floor, picnic style. Scott ha cooked garlic bread (and only garlic bread) for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is actually really good garlic bread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garlic bread is my favorite food. I could honestly eat it for every meal. Or just all the time without even stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd get fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Why would I get fat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bread makes you fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bread makes you FAT??

dialogues.speaker: '15 MINUTES LATER'
dialogues.text: A nervy Scott serenades Ramona on his bass guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I wrote a song about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it goes like this: Ra-mona, Ra-mona, Ra-ra-ra, Mona, Ra-mona, Ra-mona, Ra-ra-ra, Mona, Ooooh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to hear it when it's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished?

dialogues.speaker: '15 MINUTES LATER'
dialogues.text: Scott makes out with Ramona on the futon. Scott smiles as runs her hands through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair's pretty shaggy.

dialogues.speaker: OH GOD
dialogues.text: Scott sits up like a shot. Ramona is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. No, sorry. It's just that I got... I got a bad haircut right before me and my big ex broke up. But it's so long ago, I can barely remember it... A deep voiced NARRATOR chimes in. Earl Jones deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is acutely aware that his last salon haircut took place exactly 431 days ago, three hours before his big breakup. He blames this largely on the haircut and has been cutting his own hair ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a bad time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a mutual thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, she told me it was mutual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dumped him. It was brutal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was Nat when I knew her. But she stopped liking that name. Then...she stopped liking me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair is cute. I like it long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it'd be cuter short! Wouldn't it?! Scott disappears and just as quickly reappears, now weari his dorky SNOW HAT, hair tucked tightly beneath the flaps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why are you wearing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we could go for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: '15 MINUTES LATER'
dialogues.text: Scott and Ramona climb a STAIRWAY, long handrail between

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me we didn't come out here just so you could cover your hair with that hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo. I just love me some walking. Putting one leg in front of the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem a little...heightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I don't know. I just, when I'm with you I feel like I'm on drugs. Not that I do drugs, unless you do, in which case I do drugs all the time, every drug, but...you make me feel...I don't know. Things seem a little brighter around you or something. Ramona and Scott finally reach the top of the stairs and NIGHT TURNS TO DAY, as if crossing a magical line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A totally awesome castle. They're shooting this movie up here. Ramona looks up at the looming CASA LOMA, a castle surrou by big, bright movie set lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winifred Hailey and some actor guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
